bibl.title: Letter from John Gilman to Howard A. Kelly, July 7, 1907

div1.p: Gilman sends a contribution for Kissinger.

div1.head: Letter from John Gilman to Howard A. Kelly, July 7, 1907
div1.opener:
Ans
327 Franklin St.
Newton, Mass.
July 7, 1907.
Mr. Howard A. Kelly,
1418 Eutaw Place,
Baltimore, Maryland.
Dear Sir:=
div1.p:
Having read in the columns
of the Outlook that contributions
for Private John R. Kissinger could
be sent him through you, I am
enclosing a money order for
four dollars ($4-), hoping that
even a very small sum may
be of assistance to him.
div1.closer: Very truly yours John Abbott Gilman. (M.E.G.)
